ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.2_0: an association had prepared a meal together with robes for the Sangha. They said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.3_0: “We wish to offer you a meal and then give you robe-cloth.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.4_0: Then the monks from the group of six went to that charnel ground.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.5_0: They went to that thigh and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.6_0: “Please give these robes to these monks.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.8_0: That robe-cloth is prepared for the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.10_0: But since these monks are staying here, they are looking to you for support.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.11_0: If you don’t give to them, who will?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.13_0: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robes to them and served the food to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.14_0: The monks who knew that a meal together with robes had been prepared for the Sangha, but not that the robes had been given to those monks from the group six, said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.15_0: “Gotama, please give the robe-cloth to the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.17_0: The robes we had prepared were diverted by the monks from the group of six.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.18_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.19_0: “How could the monks from the group of six divert to an individual things they knew were intended for the Sangha?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.20_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.23_0: “... Foolish men, how could you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.24_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.25_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.26.1_0: ‘If a monk diverts to an individual material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.6_0: he knows by himself or others have told him or the candidate has told him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.8_0: it has been given to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.10_0: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicine; even a bit of bath powder, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.12_0: if they have said, “We’ll give,” “We’ll prepare,” and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.1_0: If it is intended for the Sangha and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.2_0: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.3_0: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he does not perceives it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.4_0: If he diverts to the Sangha of monks, all is intended for the Sangha, or he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.5_0: If he diverts to an individual, he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.6_0: If he diverts it to an individual, but he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.7_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.8_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.9_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.3_0: “Where may we give?” he says, “Give where your gift goes toward equipment,” “... where it goes toward repairs,” “... where it will last for a long time,” “... where you feel inspired;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.6_0: The twelfth rule, the training rule on diverting, is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.7_0: The eighth sub-chapter on legitimately is finished.
